required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extracorporeal Therapy on Shoulder and Neck Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Extracorporeal Shock Wave Therapy on Shoulder and Neck Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research was to investigate the clinical effects on the ESWT treatment of shoulder and neck pain.

detailed_description.textblock: Extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT) has been used to treat various musculoskeletal disorders. The beneficial effects of the ESWT included pain alleviation and improvement in local blood circulation. However, few study exploring the effects of the ESWT for subjects with shoulder and neck pain.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of visual analogue scale (VAS)

arm_group.description: Education have 8 movement home program for flexion, extension, side bending, rotation in neutral position, and rotation in a position of full cervical flexion.

The Extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT) was applied on upper trapezius and levator scapulae following parameters 1.5 bar, per intervention 2000 impulse, once a week for three weeks for the experimental group.

intervention.description: The Extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT) was applied on upper trapezius and levator scapulae following parameters 1.5 bar, per intervention 2000 impulse, once a week for three weeks for the experimental group
Education have 8 movement home program for flexion, extension, side bending, rotation in neutral position, and rotation in a position of full cervical flexion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-specific shoulder and neck pain
- Ages between 20yr to 45yr
- Shoulder and neck syndrome of upper trapezius and levator scapulae more than 3 months
- No using medicine such as anodyne and muscle relaxants.
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Sports Medicine, College of Medicine, Kaohsiung Medical University

Spine (Phila Pa 1976) 23 (15): 1689-1698, 1998 Cagnie B, Danneels L, Van Tiggelen D, De Loose V, Cambier D Individual and work related risk factors for neck pain among office workers: a cross sectional study. Eur Spine J 16(5): 679-686, 2007 Lee HY, Yeh WY, Chen CW, Wang JD. psychosocial risk factors of upper extremity musculoskeletal pain in industries of Taiwan: a nationwide study. J Occup Health, 47(4): 311-318, 2005. Sjölander P, Michaelson P, Jaric S Djupsjöbacka M. Sensorimotor disturbances in chronic neck pain--range of motion, peak velocity, smoothness of movement, and repositioning acuity. Man Ther 13(2): 122-131, 2008.

clinical_study.keyword: Extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT), Neck Pain
